Question: In 1909 this person and Freud traveled to the conference at Clark University.
Hints: This person saw the human psyche as "by nature religious", and made this religiousness the focus of his explorations.
In October 1925, this person embarked on his most ambitious expedition, the "Bugishu Psychological Expedition" to East Africa.
This person went on to say "the main point is to get a young and insecure science into a place of safety during an earthquake".
